attributes.action: Give money from business lunches at the Conservative Conference to UK food banks
attributes.additional_details:
We are asking that Theresa May and the Conservative Party commit to eradicating poverty in the UK. 

Theresa May and the Conservative Party should donate the money they earn at October's party conference - from selling corporations and business leaders access to our elected Government ministers - directly to UK food banks. 

Thirteen million people live below the poverty line in the UK.(https://www.trusselltrust.org/what-we-do/)
attributes.background: The Conservative Party are selling access to Theresa May and other ministers for more than £3,000 a head, to corporate executives and lobbyists who wish to attend their party conference. At the same time food bank usage in the UK is at a record high.

rejection.details: You appear to be calling on the Conservative party to take action, rather than the UK Government or Parliament. You can contact the Conservative Party here: http://www.conservativehome.com/contact-us and may want approach them directly about this issue.
